content: WORST APP TO LISTEN TO MUSIC ON. if you don't have the premium subscription, it won't play the song you request. it only lets you skip 6 songs that aren't even in your Playlist! I dont like it at all. you can select one of your Playlists but it will play a completely different song you didn't add to the Playlist.

Update: I hate this app ...been trying it for over a year for podcasts and don't find it user friendly, plus I can no longer scroll down more than a few episodes per podcast. *Constant* Premium pushes are so annoying. Dumped it for a different, way better app. Original: I only use Spotify for my podcasts ever since Google Podcasts died. Tried the Spotify Premium free trial. NONE of the ads are removed. Quit less than a week into the free trial because there was absolutely no point to it.
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: I have been a Spotify subscriber for a few years now. It has been an up-and-down relationship. For a while now, everything has worked well. My continuing disappointment however comes from the fact that I can't integrate music from my personal collection. The audiobook feature is great! There is a 15 hour time limit. Then I read about the top ups offered. I thought great! $12.99 for 10 hours? That is more than I pay for the entire plan! Make it like 2 or 3 bucks and you'll have more takers. 🤷

Terrible support. Meaning Non-Existant. No support on the app. Company has no support phone number. The email and website replies are automated and don't allow you to reply. Can't change subscription to certain options without changing to another subscription for a month in between. Only support or help you can find is a link to a Spotify Help Forum, which is just other Users also complaining about unfixed issues, and most topics are deleted by bots before anyone can see with no explanation.

this app used to be so good. now I see if I'm listening to music for too long it will cut me off but listening for too long is impossible to do because you get 3 million ads after 1-2 songs I've actually counted, the ads last as long as a song and that's another problem in itself. when I'm told 30 minute ad free listening it's more like 4-5 songs ad free and a lot of options are locked behind a paywall. overall finicky and not worth the time if you have the money.

I keep getting the same ad about a credit card company. On top of the credit card company, I get 4-6 Linkden ads. The dislike feature on ads is completely without value. Spotify free is %99 ads %1 music. No matter how many times I say I keep getting Google Gemini ads over and over again, nothing changes. "Thanks. This helps improve ads on Spotify" Is completely false.

The app design used to be spot on. I want to be able to search for an artist then when I click the profile you can go through the discography organized by year. Now, the albums aren't attached to the Artist's page. Why the hell am I paying $12 a month for such disorganization and lack of access to information and albums. Please change it back. the new update is a load of......

It's not a true shuffle. Let me recommend the programmers look up random seed(). The reviews mock your inability to shuffle. It's not that hard guys, but I get it's hard when you spend all your time programming an ad shuffle feature to make people hear the same ad so many times they hate the product/service that's being recommended.

This app is only good if you have premium, but if you dont have it then its terrible ASF. I've been a user since 2020 and the updates are just straight up garbage. You cant unshuffle your playlist or listen to it with stuff you didnt add on the playlist, Maybe smart shuffle is a good idea for people who want to discover new music...but it's not for people like me who just want to stick to music they've heard of before. fix your horrible app

The quality of the music is great, the range of options is nice too. But I'm giving the app 2 stars because you can't enjoy it unless you go premium. Having to listen to ads is bad enough, but then the app starts malfunctioning once you end your premium subscription. You select songs and they don't play, the app deliberately performs like your phone isn't connected to WiFi and other things too. For me, it seems like a desperate attempt to ship users to premium subscription.

It's an overall good concept and you'll only enjoy it as a Premium user. Period. The fact that their free version cannot let users pause music, or fast forward, or skip to the next song (you get 6 skips per hour) says a lot to buttress that point. Premium has all the good stuffs, downloading offline, no ad interruption and whatnot. But premium isn't costly, so I'll let Spotify off with 4 stars. They seem to have packages for students too, so don't worry and just go for it, it's dirt cheap.

I regret getting Spotify premium, the app is just downright slow, lags pretty much all the time when loading playlists. then it does the most nonsensical thing of taking me back to the top of the list instead of where the song is playing. my suggestion to people is to switch to apple. don't waste your money on this trash. it used to be fine back in 2016 when it wasn't available in india. idk if you still can't edit playlists, zero stars if possible
replyContent: Hi Rohit! Advertising is very much tied to the traditional podcast listening experience so, even as a Premium member, you may hear sponsorship messages within the episodes. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: It's okay, I guess but like when there's an advertisement I press the dislike button and it says it improves my ad experience but it doesn't. It just puts more ads. There's also this glitch, where if I stop playing it it continues playing. I really, REAAALLLYYY hope you fix this spotify edit: Please show how many skips I have left so i can skip the ACTUAL bad songs
replyContent: Hey! We're sorry to hear this, and we'll pass your feedback along to the Ads team. For an ad-free experience, we'd recommend checking out our Premium plans. If you've never had Premium before, you should be eligible for our trial. You can also check out other deals by heading over to spotify.com/premium.

content: Don't waste time with the free version, fork out for premium. Free version is awful, no way of sugar coating that. Do not recommend the unpaid version at all. Premium however is great! There's a huge library of albums, playlists, podcasts; it's particularly helpful being able to download songs for offline play. The Discovery Weekly playlist can be hit or miss but is greatly appreciated all the same! Some performance issues, it must be said. And we could really do without the AI junk

App works well now. Can listen to all my fave songs both on the go and at home. I currently dont mind the number of ads but when an ad does appear it forces you to go back to the Spotify app on Chromebook which is annoying and it would be great if it was like the mobile version in the fact that it doesnt force you into the app whenever an ad appears.
replyContent: We're glad to hear that. Enjoy your tunes!

content: Just switched back over after using YT Music for a year. I enjoy the DJ X feature but it has a tendency to be repetitive and it will sometimes incorrectly guess my mood. Please consider allowing us to enter a prompt of our current mood, it doesn't need to have the ability to have back and forth conversations, just the mood prompt ability and a way for us to react to the music the DJ is playing so it learns better as an A.I. This DJ feature has so much potential, please don't let it go to waste.

The oee again. Nothing has changed in years. Now I can't even listen to a Playlist, it keeps reverting to a different one! Garbage. Navigating this disaster is the height of frustration. Terrible interface, buggy, everyday settings buried deep inside menus that make no sense. This service doesn't offer anything I can't get elsewhere, and no one else tortures me to use their interface. Uninstalled, again.
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: Has cool personalized playlists, and a variety of podcasts to explore. The fact that disabling shuffle mode is a premium-only feature is tremendously annoying, however. If I just want to listen to one song at the start of a playlist, I can't, because of this unnecessary restriction. I have just a few liked songs, why does Spotify have to add some more random songs in the like playlist without my consent??? I understand that Premium must restrict a few features, but why this one?

When things go wrong on the app, like ads appearing when you're paying for Premium, it's very difficult to contact anyone to resolve the issue which is unacceptable when you pay £11 a month. This happened to me recently, and when i have more time, I will be considering finding an alternative, especially if I can find a way to import my playlists.

Premium is *ridiculously* expensive for what it is! £11.99 a month. For £1 more, you can get a monthly Netflix subscription on two devices at once. This app is WAY too expensive for a music player that you can only listen to on one device at a time. Please include more features (e.g multi device streaming at the very least) or bring the price down to make it fair for consumers. We really aren't getting our money's worth.

Managing the Queue is hit and miss. No direct menu option for it. Can add a few titles only to find, later, that the queue has been wiped. Can't change the order of play by dragging and dropping. EDIT: A year later and queue Mgt is still a mess; ye, can now change order easier, but it still seems to appear and disappear at will. Downgraded to 2 stars just to signal continued disappointment.

Spotify can you answer my question? Why have the multiple song selection been removed from the queue? It used to be so easy to queue multiple songs from different playlist but that option is no longer available. This selecting one song at a time and dragging it into position is very tedious. I seriously hope that this is rectified soon. If it isn't, I'll be cancelling my subscription and finding a new music streaming app.

Seems like every update makes this app worse, last update that came has messed it up bad. I'm using a new s24 ultra with latest software and yet again like on my pixel 8 pro the app makes it 1 to 2 songs in and just stops playing audio even tho I have 2 numbers attached with 5G on both and full signal. My music is all downloaded for offline use and I've had a premium account for atleast 10 years. If I didn't have so much music saved and Playlist made I would leave Spotify in a heartbeat.

Premium Subscription I only use for Podcasts. Since last update a few days ago podcasts in my playlists are not tracking the played time correctly. When finished it sometimes does not move to the next podcast and it does not mark them as finished. For the first few days I could move out of the screen and it would refresh but now it doesn't. I have restarted my phone multiple times and it has not resolved the issue. I do not and will not uninstall and reinstall apps. I won't do that to fix errors

Spotify at it again; any music tracks that you remove from your Playlists will subtly make it to your queue. We know how the industry works. All music loses appeal sooner or later, and not all music is popular. The more clicks, the better for the artist and the platform. However, the subscriber gets left out of listening to the composed Playlist that we set up for our preference. I mean, it's the only reason we pay, right? Spotify needs to back tf off. Pandora sounding good right about now.

Regarding how I felt before about the app, I realized how dumb it sounded to criticize my free trial ending that one time. I do love Spotify and being able to shuffle through my favorite tracks and experiment with playlists. Though, I still don't agree with having a certain amount of skips between songs and having to pay just to pick freely. But overall, the experience is pretty good.
replyContent: Hi! We’d love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: I so rarely leave reviews and I LOVE Spotify but PLEASE this latest update to the queue is devestating. I used to be able to drag queued songs "under" the queue and into the next songs from the playlist, effectively reordering what I wanted and allowing me to go back to a queued song without it "deleting" after listening once. But now even if I drag it down, if I skip past it, I can't go back :(( and once it's listened to I can't go back to it either. Please restore this! I beg.

Why do I have to pay premium if you're not letting me to switch off the shuffle mode in playlist and radio? I'm on the latest version of Spotify (Premium) and it doesnt let me play the playlist in the order, also when I switch off the shuffle it come back on in 10 seconds. I have tried restarting, reinstalling and logging in again, none of it helps. This is unacceptable that Spotify charge for this premium feature and it still doesn't work.

Spotify is an exceptional music streaming service that offers an unparalleled listening experience. Its vast music library, intuitive interface, and personalized recommendations make it a go-to platform for music lovers. The ability to seamlessly transition between devices and access a vast array of playlists and radio stations is incredibly convenient. Overall, Spotify's user-friendly design, impressive music selection, and innovative features make it an outstanding choice for anyone looking to

Increasingly janky. Increasingly glitchy. Increasingly more interested in being Tiktok than having a usable interface. Increasingly disinterested in paying artists anything at all. Oh great, more sponsored releases that have nothing to do with what interests, even after "opting out." Liked songs filter hasn't worked in at least a week, but hey at least the bar is purple now. Can we stop endlessly iterating on the interface at some point? It was good a decade ago, when it had a Play Next button.
replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search “Contact Us”, and they'll be happy to help.

content: love spotifiy so much, but the new update with the queue has almost completly ruined it. I hate that the things you add to the queue yourself isn't separate to what's in the playlist, and now I find the songs that I add get lost in the list of songs. it's a feature I use every single day.

listening to music - great! However I hate the fact that spotify are pushing their own ads inbetween podcasts. As I've already paid premium, you're now making me pay again. And no, this isn't ads included in the creators podcast, they are played separately before and after the podcast. No point paying for premium if you mostly listen to podcasts, purely because Spotify feel like they haven't made enough money out of you. Oh and trying to charge 8.99 for extra audio book hours is just plain greed

extremely ticked off that you removed the ability to remove songs queue in a PAID premium subscription. for this much money I should be able to remove songs from queue. fix it. not only that but shuffle doesn't work like it used to. I get the same songs all the time and artists in a row. that's boring. the whole purpose of shuffle is to shuffle, and get a variety of your playlist. you messed that up too. fix it.

I really enjoy this app despite not paying for premium. There's just one thing that personally for me would change it for better entirely. I yearn for an ability to customize the theme of it. I'm kind of sick of the black and green even though I know they are its signature colors. I'd love to just change the theme inside the app so it would be more personal. I'd honestly then pay for it right away lmao!
replyContent: We'd recommend adding it to our 'Ideas Board' over at community.spotify.com. Just head to the Menu > Ideas. Others will then be able to vote or add to the conversation to show their support.

content: The Wrapped 2025 was rather bland and packed with way less information compared to previous years; I would appreciate it if it was more personalized and fun, instead of very much robotic, as if it was made by AI or just incredibly rushed. Otherwise, the app is good and many bugs have been fixed regarding lagg with background play :)

Honeatly, its great but sometimes the adds are unbearable. You only get 6 skips every hour and if you want more, you need premium. All of a sudden, when I want to search up something or watch something, it just freezes on the loading screen. After some time, it says unable, try again, even though I have full wifi. I even tried with full 5G Mobile data, didn't work. Please see whats wrong. Also, I would love a button or somthing where you could queue a song after the one that you listen to. ⭐⭐⭐⭐

idk why this happens, but the app keeps closing everytime i play music on the background or when the wifi is turned on. this bug needs to be fixed immediately. i keep going back to the app just to play the song again. i can't even listen to music without getting interrupted because the app keeps closing.
replyContent: Hi! We’re sorry to hear this and thanks for letting us know. We’d like to investigate further. If you have time, could you reach out to our Customer Support team again with a screenshot of your review and our reply? You can reach them at https://support.spotify.com/contact-spotify-anonymous/.

content: Complaints are 1) Why in 2025 can y'all not figure out how to shuffle playlists? It's very basic for a music app. But it ALWAYS ends up shuffling in the exact same order. Even the DJ plays the same songs. Figure it out. 2) You have to pay for more audiobook hours when you run out or wait for it to reset. But it's said my hours reset in 10 days for almost 3 weeks. 3 days is 1 Spotify day apparently. Switched to Kindle.

I find it pointless to have "shuffle" and "play in order" to be behind premium. It should be basic interaction that should've been free. I understand the premium for downloading music, ad free, and listening offline; but having those two behind a paywall just sucks. Like, what do you mean I have to pay for something that's free on any other app? :(

Came a long way with this one. Very astonishing audio quality, the app works better than before, love the tiny new features, But need huge improvements on the shuffle, cuz I've been seeing so many times where the app would play the same songs I've listened to with very unlikely getting to listen to a new songs here and there, Either make a system to play different ganres but keep it close to what I've been listening, to keep adding new songs to the mix, or make the system better at suggesting

Not sure what's going on lately, but the app keeps crashing and freezing. I uninstalled it and reinstalled it and now can't even log in. I'll have to cancel my subscription at this rate. Getting fed up with not being able to use an app that I pay for. The error message tries to blame my Internet, but it's working fine.

Spotify compared to Amazon music is amazing I have been trying Amazon music and most of the songs that I like aren't there but that isn't a problem with Spotify. also you can watch videos on Spotify to which is amazing. for me because I have a time limit on my phone the fact that if you put something on Spotify then lock your phone it doesn't use any time where as Amazon music does use time. the one thing I don't like is you have a limit on lyrics and how many you see but other otherwise it's👍

It's way too easy to accidentally remove a song from your playlist. The button for adding/removing a song from a playlist is right beside the next song button in the drop down menu and lock screen, there have been times that I've accidentally removed songs from my playlists by accident. They should really either remove that butgon or make it like within the app where after you tap that button, they ask you what playlist you would like to add it to or remove it from.

On car mode it used to come up under google maps with a mini user interface allowing you to click on a heart to like or unlike a song, now you have to go into the app and mess around with a tiny plus or a menu and click done after deselecting to unlike. We can't eff around with the app when we are driving it needs to be one click easy access. What are you doing???
replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search “Contact Us”, and they'll be happy to help.

content: Recent update caused error/bug with playback. When playing a music or a podcast, when skipping to certain part of the episode, then clicking on the Android button to show all running apps (bottom left or right of screen) and then selecting Spotify, the content pauses (sometimes stutters) and resumes from the original skip point, so if you initially skip to 20 minutes into the episode and let it play for 10 minutes, it should resume to 30 minutes but goes back to 20 minutes.

I love using this but you seriously need to fix the DJ cause everytime I verbally request a song, it doesn't play it even if it understood me. It chooses a random song that was definitely not what I wanted. Doesn't matter how many times I do the request,it won't bring up the actual song, and it is so unbelievably annoying that it ruins the mood completely. Fix your Ai before I lose it cause it's actually so damn annoying that it can't follow a simple command.

I really like this app. it shows you lyrics, and it has many songs. it also has recommended songs, and that is super helpful. my only problem is the ads. there are way too many. and it will say that after one ad, there will be a 30 minute break, but there is not. the app is good, but the ads are way too many.

Good app for listening music. It has some issues like when I pause a song that is 5 seconds before it ends it doesn't pause; it keeps on going. Sometimes it turns into an ad when there is no premium. Sometimes the app goes off automatically (I am not doing anything.) For some reason before, the song doesn't play. Worse of all recently the app opens (I AM not also doing ANYTHING,) and makes my device lag. Spotify is good, but please fix these issues. Thanks

I allowed my Premium subscription to lapse because I was unhappy that despite paying for Premium my New Episodes feed was full of paywalled content that I couldn't play or remove from the playlist. Now the app refuses to play ANY music at all. No playlists, no albums, no songs. I regret ever paying for Spotify, because if I had never subscribed to Premium I would still be able to play music on it, even as a free user.

Unfortunately, Spotify keeps trying to dig its own grave. Songs are absolutely limited, and you can't even choose what playlist you want to use despite that. Unnecessary ads. Spotify used to be good, for both paying users and free users. They keep trying to pressure you into buying their premium by placing basic functions behind a pay wall. You're better off using Youtube music than this sorry excuse of an app.

I'm not sure what happened with the latest update, but all of the voices are sped up in the podcasts I listen to. It sounds like all of the speakers are on helium, and their voices are being fast forwarded. It is very strange. I've stopped listening to podcasts on Spotify until they fix this glitch.

I absolutely LIVE off of music. It is my comfort in any circumstance, so Spotify is amazing for me. However, I recently got Spotify Premium to get the better experience and it is indeed awesome. but I have one issue. I wish I could have the Spotify Duo Premium plan to give to a friend who doesn't have Premium. The fact that they have to live in the same country, with the same adress as me is a hindrance. We live in different countries. I wish I could have the possibility to have them on Duo.

The limited number of commercials and the inclusion of video has made this platform a fantastic alternative to YouTube for me while I am at work. I heavily recommend it since it is very user friendly for my phone especially when I just want to listen to my favorite casters and sometimes being able to watch them when I have the ability to do so.

Everytime when I'm trying to skip a song it lags out so much. Just goes super slow. To the point which it ends up closing because it says it stopped responding. I'm on Android. It didn't happen before. Started happening from the updates. I even clear cache and data still happening. Please fix this.

Edit2: it worked for a little while then it stopped again. I tried powering off my phone multiple times and didn't work. I hope tomorrow's work day it's fixed. galaxy s25ultra Edit: don't know why but I think spotify is blocking certain playlists. Can't open my 2 favorites without it crashing to home screen... piss me off I just paid for a month and can't even open my podcasts...... -5 star if you pay for it. The adds are like aids. Music, add, add, add, music, music, add, add, add, add, ect...
replyContent: We're sorry to hear this. Don't worry, our Customer Service team would be happy to help. You can reach them at http://support.spotify.com. Just search "Contact us" to see all available contact options.

content: Suddenly the queue gets deleted when I fully close the app? Since when? And adding songs to multiple playlist is a nice feature but it's messing with showing if I have a song liked and it's a nuisance having to click the add to playlist button to see if it's already liked instead of it already being visually there like up until recently.

This app is really good BUT I HATEE how you cannot pick a specific song like you can on the pc version or even other mobile devices you can! Just not on the phone version and it's annoying. I want to listen to a specific song and instead I have to deal with the shuffle playlists they make.

I really love spotify, its my only music app i use, but... the only problem are the ads, i get way to many often after 1 song. after 1 song i get up to 3/4 ads almost everytime, i wish it was only 1. and i really don't want to buy premium only because it cost money, like every app, and i prefer to not pay on apps.

I'd rate it higher as it does have a lot of good features but there's one thing it's lacking compared to all other platforms. A dislike button. I don't enjoy rap or other genres, and yet I can't dislike them to remove them from automated playlists or even their new "DJ" feature. I like other platforms as I can hit play and let a random radio start off a song, then hit dislike or like to tune it. Spotify however doesn't allow for that and almost forces making playlists.

I've stopped experiencing the broken sleep timer, but last night, I had to sit through 5 or 6 Spotify inserted ads before the podcast I wanted to listen to started (and I could set the timer). This is for a service I pay for. I'm not sure how much control the podcaster (who obviously publishes directly through Spotify because they advertise Spotify for podcasters) But either way, that's too much. I mostly pay for Spotify for music, but at this point, I'd recommend a different ap for podcasts.
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: Music is OK, but podcasts are buggy and crawlingly slow (eg 20 minutes to open new episodes, then another 20 to open 'My episodes'). Hopeless. So much so, as to make the app virtually unusable. Samsung Galaxy s21 fe 5g all up to date, plenty of space, FAST. IT professional!

moved from another prominent app to this one. The music selection is great, but the Ui is a total let down... can't pick or drop songs into active play lists, still plays music that's been hidden. app frozen and not allowed me to play songs or can't play songs when connection drop out even after subscribing
The app isn't working very well at all. It's a Spotify issue... my sister and I are on the same account different devices and it is doing it to both of us. What is wrong with Spotify????

content: Between battery life issues to the app adding songs to my Playlist without my permission this app is absolute trash. You don't add hidden features like customizing your customizable Playlist automatically in a shady way without trying to collect shady data on people. Will never be subscribing to such a worthless app. Deleted.

Basically the origin of the "Wanna break from the ads?" meme, yes really funny i know. Indeed, it has so many ads you would just wanna listen to a looped song on Youtube (it doesn't put ads in-between, for now). It has a massive song and music library, but also podcasts and videos for the sake of the capitalistic economy. Premium is a scam at this point. Why even make this app famous in the first place?

Spotify could use some help handling technical issues. I am a student and have been using the premium student + Hulu discount for months to a year now. Made a payment late and lost my entire music/podcasts logs along with being denied as a student. To make things worse. I tried to log-in to Hulu after hours of Spotify trying to fix the problem I could not log-in to Hulu. I ended up having to pay an additional amount to have an account with Hulu. I think this will be last paid acct with Spotify.

Randomly losing my place on whatever I'm listening to, view settings constantly changing away from what I set them to and updates from podcasts not appearing.. Probably time to look at another option..
