content: Amazing app. literally perfect, no issues.
replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search “Contact Us”, and they'll be happy to help.

content: I love all the different playlists on here,, they let me explore different genres and often I find music I haven't listened to in years! I also like that if I want to just listen to an artist, or an album, I can do that too! I haven't been at a loss for good music since I started using this app!

Spotify is a good app for music.But the fact is if you want to listen to an audiobook which it does have a good selection of you have a specific amount of time even though you have premium And once you're Out of time it makes you pay 12 extra dollars or wait until your next bill. Why do I have to pay at 12 extra dollars? When I'm already paying 13, just to have the app
replyContent: Hey there! We suggest reaching out to our Customer Service at http://support.spotify.com for further help. Just search "Contact Us", and they'll be happy to assist.

content: It has had such potential for so long... But falls short on so many things! This review box doesn't have enough characters & I am over trying to convey this to someone important who wants to listen (tried beta vs, tried online suggestions, etc). Was switching to SoundCloud then the audiobooks were added! Still think more audiobook hours should be available on premium - 15hrs = 1.25 books/month & unfair some podcasts added to audiobook category & therefore included in this 15hr allowance.

Works well for me and it's my main music app. I just rated it 4 stars because in the latest update for some reason when I turn off the phone while inside a playlist and turn it on again, the list refreshes and jumps back to the top of the list and then I have to scroll down to get to the song. It becomes annoying with long lists like Liked Songs.

i would rate this 4 or 5 stars if it wasn't for one thing : my playlists. basically, it automatically sets you up with a 'liked songs' playlist with things that you like. I'm not sure if its for all playlists or just for this specific one, but after finishing the whole playlist, instead of playing from the first song again, it randomly plays songs that aren't in my playlist. It's so annoying. i might change it if its changed, but if it isn't, I'm most likely changing music apps.
replyContent: Hey. Please reach out to our team for help with this. You can reach them at https://support.spotify.com/contact-spotify-anonymous/.

content: Pretty frustrating if you don't have premium. Adverts I get, but being unable to pick the song you want to listen to or even see what's on an album is pretty irritating. £8+ per month is too much to spend on the 'privilege' of choosing my songs. Edit- now you can't even listen to the album selected!! Even when the album has over the songs needed to stop Spotify putting in it's own songs. I tried to listen to a soundtrack with over 30 songs and do you think it played that album, not a song.

"Music is beautiful... And I want where you turn to play the songs to be just as special." ROTFL. Terrible user experience for classical music in terms of search, information and choice. UI/UX still needs a lot of work. Cannot copy link in Android or iOS and share to Messenger - does not work for the recipient. Ridiculous how long Spotify has been going now and the software is so poor. Annoying that it needs a data connection to access a downloaded audio book.

Spotify without Premium is basically unusable. I can’t pick the songs I want, I can’t skip tracks, I can’t even see my queue. It’s like tuning into a random radio station, except even that little bit of enjoyment gets crushed by endless, annoying ads. The only choice I have is the music genre, and even then, they manage to ruin it. Spotify strips away almost every bit of control and enjoyment unless you pay. It’s frustrating and disappointing.

You're better off playing from your web browser. Works much better. For some reason they made core features as simple as looking up or pausing the music dependent on internet connection. So if your internet isn't the fastest it can take 30 seconds or more just to pause a track. This isn't a tech support issue, it's by design. Spotify Connect isn't secure enough either.
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: the free version of the website is fantastic, a perfect music player. the free version of the mobile app has been intentionally hamstrung in a dozen ways to make it virtually impossible to use for any function other than putting things on shuffle- and even then, regularly interrupted by ads talking about got they can make all the pain go away for a low, low ongoing cost.

Spotify is pretty good. When playing music it's great. The suggested songs are great and continue with same vibes of what I was playing. Awesome to put it on, select a few songs, and let it buck for hours of good suggested songs. The only reason I'm giving it 2 instead of 5 stars is because you can not turn off suggested podcasts. STOP PLAYING JOE ROGAN!!!!! When listening to podcasts it randomly puts on the stupid Joe Rogan experience. I've never listened to it and sure as hell don't want to

My experience has yet to change with Spotify. I like using the blend with my friends, however it does not show songs we have in common anymore- just a symbol of our profile next to 1 song. We have no clue except the blend story. The ad buttons are unbearable, I have yet to use premium,however, I noticed that the thumbs down button for Spotify doesn't help at all. I've heard something over and over again, and I dislike it each time. Please fix this.
replyContent: Hi there. Our Customer Service team would be happy to help with this. You can reach them at http://support.spotify.com. Then, search for "Contact us" to see all available contact options.

content: Spotify really needs to improve how it handles duplicate songs. I have several tracks already saved to my favorites, yet I keep seeing the same songs with the option to “save” again—just because they’re from different albums or versions. This is confusing and ruins the experience. Users shouldn’t have to investigate or rely on external apps just to know if a song is already in their library. I expected better attention to such a basic feature.

Spotify has always felt like that lost child in the music industry. They have many good songs, they have many good podcasts. There IS good content on their platform. However... The new stuff they try to integrate, like shuffling a song even though it shuffles the same songs all the time, or this new AI feature, that yaps through each song or gives you unnecessary stats that Spotify has collected on you over the years instead of just playing the damn music, makes this very hard to recommend.

The listening experience is okay but the functionality has become horrible. Was trying to remove some songs from the queue, but the new "slide" gesture to remove songs from the queue is horrible and doesn't function smoothly at all. Removing multiple songs at once is a nightmare. The previous function of selecting multiple songs at once to remove from the queue was far better. Just bring back the old function, not everything needs to be changed for improvement.

this app used to be great in the past: no overflow of ads, nice UI that's easy to use, and even if the basic version had ads and limited skips, it wasn't a big deal.....but NOW? ads after and before every song even tho it shows the "ad free 30 mins" ad thing from time to time, the layout is dogcrap and doesn't look right and the only way you could enjoy using this app is if you bought premium....this was a great app but now people are looking for alternatives due to its insane flaws. ★☆☆☆☆
replyContent: Hey! We're sorry to hear this, and we'll pass your feedback along to the Ads team. For an ad-free experience, we'd recommend checking out our Premium plans. If you've never had Premium before, you should be eligible for our trial. You can also check out other deals by heading over to spotify.com/premium.

content: Frustrating Experience with Spotify Free Version Using Spotify has become really annoying lately. I play one song, and then I’m forced to sit through 5 minutes of ads — sometimes even more! It completely ruins the listening experience. I get that it’s a free version, but the ad-to-music ratio is ridiculous. Instead of enjoying music, I’m just waiting for ads to end.

Although it plays music for the most part, the ability to add songs to anything is very, very slow in the mobile version. I'll stick to using the Windows version for that. A plus side is that I can download music playlists which automatically update when new songs are added. But trying to do anything other than play songs is beyond this mobile application.

Spotify is good for personalization and discovering music, but the rest is meh. The limitations put on free listeners is excessive and makes listening to music inconvenient. The "30 mins of ad free listening" never happens. I'd listen to 2 short songs and then get 3 ads. You also can't listen to any specific song you want without premium. Reading lyrics is now a premium feature as well, even though you can just Google them. I'd rather use a platform that allows me to listen as I please for free.

Experiencing a bug that's been going on for a while now where you're on a playlist (mines quite long), you to to another app and then return to Spotify and it just jumps to the top of the playlist which is annoying when you want to change to a song further down from where you were currently at. Another bug as well - pressing my home button will change to a song that's by thr home button interrupting what I'm listening to. This never used to happen. Other than this - all good.
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: It's a good app for me, since I really like music. However, I'm a free listener; I never payed for anything in this app. One of the things I hate is how many songs I can play before I can't play what I like and Spotify just plays a random song; another thing I hate is how really REALLY random the next songs are to the point that it doesn't fit the original vibe. For example: one minute, I'm playing a song like Convergence by Thaehan, and next minute Ed Sheeran begins singing Shape Of You or smth

The app itself is good, I bought premium and all, I had no issues for the couple of years. However, now I'm experiencing one problem—the app is slow to load. I've checked my wifi, and it's fast and has no issue, I restarted the app and even my phone, yet the slow loading still proceeds to happen. Please fix this, devs. Thank you I'll give it 5 stars when it's all good!
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: Poor app performance, merely adequate que features, and it sometimes forgets that I downloaded a song or album. It is very obnoxious about getting me to use 'smart shuffle' which I don't like, and the regular shuffle is heavily biased towards certain songs. It's not like these issues make the app unusable. But I see no reason why Spotify can't be excellent, and it's very frustrating.

DO NOT RECOMMEND! You cannot play a song on loop, only 6 skips per hour, you cannot play a specific path from the song and a point you CANNOT EVEN play the song of your choice. it says, "chose songs to play again tomorrow". 😐 Honestly Spotify, you would be a WAY better app if you guys just made more features available. you are already taking so much of our time and energy. ALSO 30 mins of uninterrupted listening is not real. We get an ad right after 1 or 2 songs.

it "WAS" the best music app ever. The recent software updates just removed the music app's core functionality; practically everything now requires a premium subscription. I've been using it for almost four years. These latest improvements made nothing easier or better; everything appears to be obsolete at this time. Listening to music used to be wonderful, but now it's just annoying because there's no way to listen to songs the way we want to; deleting is the only option if this doesn't improve

It does not open on my laptop and remains stuck on the dark loading screen no matter what I try. I have tried reinstalling, resetting the laptop, checking for updates, nothing has worked. It used to work a few months back, but hasn't worked since. Even prior, the app had quite alot of issues on any of my pcs and laptops; freezing, audio glitches and even crashing. I can only listen to spotify music on my xbox and that still crashes from time to time. I am very disatisfied.

I usually rarely write reviews, but as of lately, playlists and albums have been extremely buggy. Each time I enter into lockscreen and go back into the app, the playlist or album I'm listening to automatically scrolls to the top. I have followed every suggestion I've seen through support to fix this, logging out/in, doing a clean uninstall, clearing cache, yet it still doesn't fix the problem. overall, the app is really good, this bug however is what ruins things for me.

This app is becoming less and less accessible for people who can't afford to waste money. The shuffle needs to be paid, if not then you can't go back to the last/past song. You can't even check what the next song is. You can only listen to 15 minutes of music before an ad pops up, it would've been fine but the ads are over 3 minutes long. I understand the ads but you are making features that make a music player useful by being free, useless by having to pay for it. Great way to lose customers.

Spotify worked well until recently. Now it's 100% unusable - not responding to commands or responding with several MINUTES delay to move forward, open a playlist, do anything. It's really frustrating that nothing works properly anymore (very delayed or ending in error). I thought it's maybe because of Samsung Flip 6 but it's equally terrible on Lenovo tablet. If this continues for much longer, there will be no reason why to pay the subscription. I can't use the app anyway.
replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search “Contact Us”, and they'll be happy to help.

content: Being able to stream over mobile data keeps disappearing. Edit: Yes, I've reinstalled a couple of times actually, to no avail. I've heard of this happening randomly to people, it happened to me before and was "fixed' for a little while after a phone update. I have changed nothing else on my phone, all other apps needing mobile data work as usual. Stop telling us to jump hoops and figure our the issue on your end please.
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: Recently when I'm playing a song in a playlist and I turn the screen off/lock the screen, when I return the playlist reloads and returns to the top of the list so I have to scroll all the way down to find my place again. This might be a bug or an attempt to push people to use the play queue, but it is annoying. The play queue doesn't display all songs in a list, so if you want to play a particular song or songs in order as placed in your custom list, you can't.
replyContent: Hi! We're sorry to hear you're having trouble with the app. We'd recommend clearing your cache following the steps under "Storage Information" > "Manage memory usage" at http://support.spotify.com. If you’re still having issues, we’d recommend getting in touch with our Customer Service. Just search for “Contact Us”, and they'll be happy to help.

content: Look it's great for music. I think the stupid mini music videos are pointless and just keep my screen awake. The biggest annoyance is the audiobook feature. There is a great library but 15 hours per month is such a ridiculous and arbitrary figure. I read one book just over 4 hours and a second just over 10 hours, but unfortunately didn't pay close enough attention to the minutes and got cut off with 12 minutes to go. This took only 4 days. Why not allow one book per month.

Complete bs app.. full of ads and placed limitations on basic functionalities, like limits on skipping, seeking and even with choosing a song. And yeah, don't forget about them ads😮‍💨. Apple music or even YT music apps are way better compared to this waste of an app! Some limitations here and there are fine but this, this is just too much for a simple person to handle. In short, I'm fully fed-up and no longer wanna waste my storage for this...

Love this app. Brilliant choice of songs and you can always find whichever one you are looking for. I Love making my own playlists plus others which other people have made. I love all the music that Spotify puts together for me. some brilliant podcasts too. Couldn't live without this app. I pay £11.99 per month (as of 2025) on premium and it's worth every penny as I use this app for all my listening needs. Best music app out there by far. Love it.

Generally like spotify because it has a great selection, but it keeps adding songs to my playlist even though I've turned off that feature. Then I can't skip the songs anymore that Spotify added that I never wanted to listen to in the first place, and what's even the point of using the app then? The free version is just awful but I don't want to spend the money on premium when I already have so many problems with the app.

use the app all the time but it's full of bugs, keep getting adds in podcasts now and then even though I pay through the nose for premium, also the app keeps changing how I listen to podcasts 'oldest - unplayed' I keep having to change it back all the time, very frustrating. new headache is if app is open on my phone the picture of the band is moving around the screen etc, this is distracting and using data, I can't seem to find a way to make it stop and be a static picture like it used to be.
replyContent: Hey there! If you have time, can you reach our Customer Service? Search “Contact Us” at http://support.spotify.com. They'll be happy to help.

content: This app has been horrible the past couple of months. I don't know if it's because I only use the free version, but the app force closes while I'm listening to podcasts. it was great up until a few months ago. Now, through a couple hour podcast, it'll just shut down atleast 4 times. I have to go back into the app and wait while it reboots to press play again.

good app like yeah, music, and all that, but dude, no way it gets to the point where I have to pay to listen to a song, bro. I understand the ads and im trying to understand the 6 skips per hour because the app developers need to benefit from the app but comeon, it can NOT get to the point where I have to now wait AN ENTIRE DAY to listen to songs now after a certain limit. I personally don't have a way to pay for premium, I'm being fully honest, and this is getting ridiculous. please do better.

Spotify's been better recently but there's still a semitransparent inset on the status bar at all times, even in the player. On ios it's edge to edge everywhere except in the player when a canvas is playing (not just a color background and cover art). On Android the dark inset is on playlists, the homepage, these are all places that could be edge to edge. Also tapping the screen during a canvas should not make it fullscreen, moving all of the buttons by accident with one infuriating. Delete that

idk how to rate half stars so here we go with 2. It's ok, it's the classic spotify, but, to be honest, ads makes it almost impossible to listen. Every 2/3 songs, there are 2 ads. and not being able to choose the song i want to play, idk it's kinda boring. My idea would be, yes, i get that you need something to be paid for, but, what if you make that someone can paid for what he wants? like, idc about the downloading offline, but i do care about the ads, so, i could pay only for the ads.

I used Spotify and Spotify premium for years but I hate it so much by now. The app got more and more useless and more annoying to work with. It's impossible to change the location in the app which makes it extremely annoying when travelling to change it every few days because NOTHING works if the location is not correct. No idea why it has to be so complicated to change it and doesn't have an option in the app but makes me swap to competitors.
replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search “Contact Us”, and they'll be happy to help.

content: after several years of being a customer, the app became practically unusable. its so slow in response, it lags, takes several minutes to boot up. Not to mention the algorithm has been in favor of radio global hits and tiktok songs, and not finding new and interesting artists for a while now. Please at least fix the technological aspect of it!
replyContent: Hi! We’re sorry to hear this. We’d like to investigate further. If you have time, could you reach out to our Customer Support team again with a screenshot of your review and our reply? You can reach them at https://support.spotify.com/contact-spotify-anonymous/.

content: The functionality of the app is great, but using the free version, the experience is becoming less pleasant. I mostly use it for podcasts but the number of ads is constantly increasing while they continue to reduce your ability to skip or choose individual songs an now how many podcasts you can listen to in the order you choose until the next day etc. So, as a user, you are providing more and more of your time for their advertising while receiving an incrementally worse user experience.

I’m really disappointed with how Spotify works lately. When I try to play a specific song, it either doesn’t let me or starts playing something completely different. I just want to listen to the song I choose, not random tracks the app picks for me. It’s super frustrating, especially when I’m in the mood for something specific. Please fix this.
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: Spotify is probably the app that I use the most. However, lately it hijacks my phone. It starts to play at random times at night while I am asleep, the other day it started to play WHILE I WAS IN A MEETING and my phone was set to mute, it even plays at random times when I am not even near my phone. I changed my password multiple times, I uninstalled and re-installed and updated the app several times, I set everything so it isn't on autoplay, and it still persists. HELP!
replyContent: Hi there! We understand your concern and our Customer Service can help you out. To reach them, search “Contact Us” at http://support.spotify.com. They'll be on the lookout for your reply.

content: it is like this app is designed to be as frustrating and buggy to use as possible. if I have no internet and open an offline playlist, why does it try to connect for 2 minutes to the internet and not show songs. recent bugs include not being able to play or queue a song (the only way to play anything is to random shuffle a playlist) Daniel Ek (CEO) doesn't believe in paying artists fairly and is pushing a race to the bottom while keeping as much of the revenue for himself.

Spotify is a great way to listen to music but i hate that we have to pay for an additional fee to listen to audiobooks. As I had already paid to use premium (which is totally worth it) I still wasn't able to listen to audiobooks which frustrated me to no end as i was unable to read the book in any other way. Without premium ads are the worst! Having an ad every other song made me not want to use Spotify at all. Maybe shrink the amount?

Every update makes this app worse. Smart shuffle that you can't turn off completely Constant "recommendations" that everyone knows are just paid for App won't stop pestering me about certain concerts Worst of all: podcasts. I have no interest in podcasts. There should be some toggle to turn off podcasts completely. If I want podcasts, I'll search for them. Used to be really great around two years ago, but enshittification has started.

Used to love these apps. I don't mind paying for the premium but nowadays the price is getting higher and higher. Most of my songs aren't available in the apps anymore (?). one thing I hate is all the mini plans (day and week pass) are now removed. The ads are getting crazier, it's annoying unless you paid for the premium. I ain't paying for the monthly pass when I'm not using this app frequently.

Very good. Just a bit expensive for premium and smart shuffle is pretty dumb since it keeps on reccomending tracks i dont like even if I say that I dont like it. That I added 1 slowed song doesn't mean i suddenly need to have my playlist full off it. The buttons and functions are pretty good and easy to navigate. i wish though you could make parts of your playlist a group like in the offline backup playlist. Very good app though. Only failed me once.

The user interface is not built with the user in mind but with Spotify's desire to shove their recommendations your way whether you want it or not. The podcast management ability is dire, especially its inexplicable need to give you old podcasts rather than the latest ones from a series. Every so often it forgets what you're listening to and jumps to another track or podcast, or forgets where it got to on a previous track or podcast, both of which are infuriating.
replyContent: It looks like other people feel the same way. We'd recommend adding your vote at community.spotify.com. Just head to the Menu > Ideas and search for "podcast reset".

content: App no longer at the place I last ended within a playlist after minimising and returning to the app. On closing and opening again, it's back to the top of the playlist. Also goes to the top of the playlist when going back from the current song playing within that same playlist. Highly irritated by this, as it never was an issue in the past.
replyContent: Hi! We’re sorry to hear this and thanks for letting us know. We’d like to investigate further. If you have time, could you reach out to our Customer Support team again with a screenshot of your review and our reply? You can reach them at https://support.spotify.com/contact-spotify-anonymous/.

content: I wrote a review before. Honestly, Spotify is great, I don't mind the two ads that pop up every 2-3 songs, I've learnt to live with it but one thing that has really been bothering me is the fact that my music just stops playing. Like the app suddenly closes or stops working for some reason. It's gotten to the point where I don't enjoy opening the app to listen to my music. I don't know if it's just me, but I've tried exiting and restarting my phone and yet I still experience issues like this.
replyContent: Hey there! Can you try logging out > restarting the device > logging back in to see if it makes any difference? If it doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at https://support.spotify.com/contact-spotify-anonymous/ and they'll be happy to help.

content: Very slow at browsing (own) libraries. Takes often over 20seconds to respond. Must be a edge case on my phone, but this is for at least 3 months now. Samsung S8 - i have also a dev account that sometimes creates and removes lists. But i have only <40 playlists. Playing songs is without problemes, no matter if cached from device or fresh downloaded. It's just the 'browsing through content'. Every click costs seconds.
replyContent: Hey, we're sorry to hear you're having trouble. We'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at http://support.spotify.com. Just search “Contact Spotify”, and they'll be happy to help.

content: So much greed from Spotify. I haven't thought how Spotify has restricted my right of choice to listen music from my own liked playlist. I have so many alternative but I chose Spotify. But today I'm very disappointed with this decision of developers who restricted the right to chose songs( even they allowed only 6 skips per day). I think I don't want your mercy and just want to remind that people have so many alternatives where they can choose what they want to hear.

Spotify is supposed to be a music app and yet it is the complete opposite. It spams ads, it doesn't have the songs I want to listen to, and now I can't listen to a specific song and get given a song that's completely irrelevant to the song I originally intended on listening to! This should be fixed otherwise its just going to be a big issue.
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: I really think Spotify is an amazing app but there is one annoying problem that makes me want to throw this phone around the room, there is this thing on Spotify that adds songs to playlists you make that you can't remove which is super annoying, another problem is is that it will not let me listen to one song on it's own I have to listen to a whole playlist. So that is what I wanted to say and I hope this song adder will be removed.
replyContent: Hi, there! We'd recommend adding it to our 'Ideas Board' over at community.spotify.com. Just head to the Menu > Ideas. Others will then be able to vote or add to the conversation to show their support.

content: this app is awesome. I make playlists and listen to them easily all day, random song playing option is very good. I don't have premium, bored of ads but it's ok, I feel like spotify has quality. because u listen to the actual song, it's better than youtube. the main reason I wanted to try it is yt had watch history and I had to delete every single song i listen to, but now I'm free. in premium u can download it offline, I'd like to try it. I download songs on yt for now. music is life guys...👽

After the recent update, it is basically useless. I can't play ONE song I want on repeat. The shuffle is premium only and the navigation just sucks. Before, I enjoyed using the app despite the ads and even planning to go premium but now I can't even choose a song? What's the purpose of a music app then?? I know you work so hard dev but please don't make ridiculous updates for your customer. (24/4) Edit: I've closed my account and deleted the app. Maybe I'll try it again sometime. Thanks, dev.

This app never works when you want it to. Everytime I try to play a song I have to wait 5 mins for the app to play it, if it decides to even play it, of course ads always play. Everytime I have addressed the issue they claim it is on your end and do nothing to resolve the issue. Yet they raise memberships and ask for more money, although the quality of their service has declined. They know they have the most popular music app so they do not care to change; they know you'll keep coming back.

Initially there were restrictions on several songs but now, not even the ads are as annoying as the disruption in playing a song of your choice. You're asked to SWITCH TO PREMIUM no matter which category you opt. After few songs, it changes whatever you select. So far so good for a bunch of songs but NOT TOLERABLE in regard to the premium marketing.

Bad experience. It's basically useless without premium. It's hard to navigate, It plays music that is NOT in my playlist. It actively adds songs I'm not interested in listening to to my playlist AUTOMATICALLY that are impossible to delete. And all this started to happen when I ran out of time on my free trial to a subscription I can't afford at all 🤔 Not to mention the definitely NOT AGE APPROPRIATE content appearing as soon as I open the app. Awful
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: I have never been so annoyed with trying to listen to music and not being able to pick the song I want to listen to. "you have chosen all the music you wanna listen to so we will just give you music that we choose". pay walls are annoying and I'm not sure how people use this app every day. I'd suggest downloading music for free somewhere else. Do not waste your money on Music if it's not live in concert

been playing my Playlist in order over and over for days (music used for mental health). all of a sudden tonight I get my 1st ad, after it plays my music is all shuffled. no good at all for what it's being used for. if I want my Playlist to play in the order I chose, I have to pay for premium service. even tho it's been playing in order for weeks. you can't turn off smart shuffle without paying. now that the app is useless to me I'm deleting it.

Greetings, Spotify, the constant ads after every single song are unbearable. My music listening is constantly disrupted by back-to-back commercials. It feels like I'm spending more time listening to ads than to the music I want. This aggressive ad frequency makes the free version practically unusable and completely ruins the listening experience. Thank you
replyContent: Hi there, thanks for your feedback. No worries, we'll pass this along to the Ads team. For an ad-free experience, we'd recommend checking out our Premium plans. If you've never had Premium before, you should be eligible for our trial. You can also check out other deals by heading over to http://spotify.com/premium.

content: Hey guys, it seems the play/pause button does not work from the notification pane on Galaxy A50. Also, the 'Local audio files' feature needs sub-filtering for easy sorting instead of just showing random audio files all at once. It's a headache to browse thru local audio files that way. Please put an option for users to choose specific local folders only. And can you please bring back the 'Add to Home screen' feature for playlists also? That was so useful. But everything else is great! Thank u 💚
replyContent: Hey, that's odd. We’d recommend reinstalling the app by following the steps from our support site. Just head to support.spotify.com and search for "Reinstall Spotify". If this doesn’t help, we suggest contacting our Customer Service so they can look into this. You can find them by searching ‘Contact us' instead.

content: Still a good UX for music, but I'd no longer recommend using it for podcasts. The episode feed for your chosen podcasts now has locked episodes from other podcasts inserted into it to try to get you to subscribe to them. You can't filter them out, nor can you mark as completed unless you subscribe to that show - which just adds a chore to your day. I hope they change it or at least add a filter option for Premium, but for the moment they've completely neutered their podcast functionality.

I shouldn't be obligated to pay just to listen to music in a MUSIC APP. Each time i click on the song i want to listen to, it will play absolutely any song BUT the song i clicked on. I also can't listen to playlists normally without an absolutely random songs starting to play, I can't pick a certain song from the playlist too. What's the point in this being a music app if I'll go insane and have voices in my head singing me the right song better than Spotify will ever be able to play one for me.

Used to work really well, now it stops song whenever there is a notification. Even keeping phone on vibrate/silent doesn't fix this issue. really disappointed that this issue started the day that I paid for 6 months subscription. now I am stuck with a music app that fully stops playback everytime there is any notification on my phone. very irritating, and unable to enjoy music with Spotify anymore. I even tried deleting cache, and doing a fresh reinstall.
replyContent: Hi! We’re sorry to hear this. We’d like to investigate further. If you have time, could you reach out to our Customer Support team with a screenshot of your review and our reply? You can reach them at https://support.spotify.com/contact-spotify-anonymous/. We will surely do our best to help you with the issue.

content: I have not had a good que in about a year. algorithm is awful. My "on repeat" is full of songs i dont like, dont even recognize and bore me to death. Shuffle is awful and the intelligent shuffle doesn't actually track what u want to listen to or skip. The app is buggy and i will often have my pc on at the same time so i can actually skip the songs without it lagging. I wish i didnt already have thousands of songs saved cuz i would leave otherwise. I miss playlist radio

the app keeps getting worse and worse but they keep raising the price. glitches, random pauses, playing random songs off a playlist and now as of may 13th while playing music from a playlist its playing songs at random within the playlist instead of in order. shuffle isnt on and no other settings were changed. the audio volume between the "DJ" and tracks is wayyyy too loud. theres too many problems with this app to justify its cost.

instead of preventing a specific artist from playing, there could be an option to hide a genre. when clicking to play a song, the entire previous queue is lost. there could be an option to always add it to the queue after the current song ends, ensuring that the current playback queue is never lost unless the user wants it to be. there are some mods that offer a dark amoled interface, something that could have been in the original. on my home screen, songs that i don't want to hear always appear

The app is only good when you pay Premium. Other than that, you can do barely anything and it basically forces you to pay for the most basic features, like turning off "intelligent shuffle", which is a horrible feature, or the desperate amount of advertisement and even limited choice of songs to listen to at the time.

I am enjoying the app and use it daily , but I do not like the 'DJ' recommendations. Also, the Daily playlists used to provide new music, now it's just repetitive and recommending the same songs from the same artist from different albums. Please add sort by play count feature. I would like to listen to music that I have in my playlists, that have not had much attention. Thanks

I don't want to be a bit too harsh, but I don't like how it tells me how poor I am. I get it, but please tone down with all the premium features. I have a suggestion though: The amount of times you could pick a song stacks, same with the skip one. Example: If you didn't use Spotify for a day, the amount of times you could pick a music gets stacked so instead of 6, it becomes 12. I can't really explain it that well, but I hope you get my concept.

Spotify used to be a great music streaming platform even with ads every now and then in the past. But wth? It doesn't even let me select specific songs on my playlist that used to be doable but now? either not after 10-20 skips that's limited to 6 per hour or wait until tomorrow for the ability to pick that specific song. And for the 'Smart Shuffle', it just loops through a small portion of my playlist even the cache was cleared. and I'm not buying premium again since DJ X just loops songs order

Spotify is great for its wide range in selection and that's about it. It's algorithms infest the listening experience like termites. Playlists are made repetitive if you play on shuffle since the algorithm searches for chill and mild listening experiences regardless of the genre. 5 years ago it was fantastic for discovering music, but not so much any more. It's AI DJ is cancer to the music industry.

It is a good app for music but I just have one problem. Everytime I play my playlist, a random song plays all the sudden. Like, it's nice if you're suggesting songs to me but it's just annoying. I just wanna listen to my songs, not random songs or artist I don't know. But even though, it's a great app.

This is the worst music player app I've ever used. It's getting worse day by day. Spotify clearly only cares about premium users and keeps removing basic features for free users — limited skips, no control over what songs to play, and way too many ads. It's really frustrating. I'm uninstalling this app because of all these issues. If you only care about premium users, fine — I'll move on to a better app.

I've been using the app for years now and honestly, I've never been more disappointed. A few years ago, this app offered a lot for free. But now, almost everything is on premium. There's a limit to the times I pick a song, I skip it, or even look at the lyrics. It makes me feel a bit disappointed as someone who doesn't use money on apps. I know that you do it for a reason but I hope it doesn't come to the stage that the whole app will be premium and I can't use it anymore.

I actually loved Spotify and I also upgraded to premium for half a year but had to cancel it because it is way to expensive for one alone and not everyone has someone to share and only students get a discount sadly. Since I canceled my premium I only get ads or I can listen to two songs out of my playlist and then it plays recommended songs even though my playlist wasn't over. I'm really disappointed in Spotify and how it developed.

Spotify is just earning money from companies for advertisement and subscribers for ad free music! Everything was good when I took subscription, and now it's disaster. Who gives 3-4 ads after every song ? Worst part, one ad says 'enjoy the next 30 mins of uninterrupted music' and the next ad starts right after it. I think rational people should stop using Spotify now.

actually Spotify, has some serious issues its still solid on my other devices. On my smartphone i experience ear-hurting increase off volume lately. when the app is set to loudness, already listening to the loudest possible volume and it switches a song, the next song regardless of type content and mood, its louder than my device can deliver, everything is distorted and it literally hurts my ears, when decrease the volume it starts rising again with next one, if i dont, it still increases volume

The premium plan is FANTASTIC. Song radio is very useful for finding related music. Discover weekly playlists are great for discovering new music. The free version is ABYSMAL. Not having the option to turn off smart shuffle could mean that you will have to listen to 3 or 4 songs suggested by spotify, as well as a few ads, before hearing something from your playlist. Bottom line, pay these greedy $O Beez for premium.

Not as user friendly as I thought. I have thought with premium I play all the songs of my favourite artist in 1 playlist. But I still need to find some of there song to add on the queue which is very tiring. Considering I am paying to play all there songs. Anyways I do not recommend. I will be cancing soon as I have finish what I am paying for. Very disappointed. What a waste.

I love the app, my only issue would be not being able to sign onto a family plan that my partner has. We even attempted to get assistance from Spotify support, only for them to tell us that their system has prevented me from signing back on due to a protection protocol, and this will be in place for 12 months, and there's nothing they can do on their end to rectify this.

It's very tedious to control in what order Spotify will play episodes in a podcast, every time after launching the application. For some reason, the application resets the settings to All episodes every time. Even if I set it to Unplayed before. And today I discovered that the Unplayed function has been removed from the application!
replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search “Contact Us”, and they'll be happy to help.

content: Very poor navigation capabilities. Switching between home and library looses the current position of the playlist. Opening another app looses your current position in the playlist. Scrolling throug a playlist is all but smooth (i have a good smartphone and tablet, it is certainly not hardware related nor should it be as this should be file manager like resources utilization) Using the searchbar for Spotify (not playlists), returns podcast results. this app is good,but with time it force us to buy the premium. it enables us to play songs as we wish to play. they stops skips and replay.we can't even play songs as we wish. please fix it. I don't think there is something new in premium. they are just Bounding us to play music in normal Spotify.

I initially thought the ability to remove songs from the playback queue was missing, which was frustrating. However, I’ve now discovered that this feature is available via a left-swipe gesture — a great and clean approach! That said, it might be helpful to make this gesture more intuitive or include a brief tooltip or visual cue for first-time users. Enhancing discoverability can ensure users don’t overlook useful features like this.

it's a good music app, but the price is kinda high not everyone can afford it every month 😞 why can't it be $9.99 or $10.99 a month like YouTube I would feel better paying that, instead of $12.69 plus tax which comes to $14.59 it's quite a bit for a music app. Maybe have some kind of deal where people can sign up at $9.99 or $10.99. I like Spotify I got SO upset when I saw the price rise.
replyContent: We'd recommend adding it to our 'Ideas Board' over at community.spotify.com. Just head to the Menu > Ideas. Others will then be able to vote or add to the conversation to show their support.

content: Have been a spotify premium user for many years. Now I am an intermittent spotify free user. Oh what a dissapointment. Spotify free has become a patronizing monster: On top of mandatory ad listening (fair enough) it clutters your playlists with their song recommendations. Which of course are mandatory to listen to. You are not allowed to skip more than 6 songs an hour. I doubt that this utterly nonsens convinces any new free user to become a premium user.

I love Spotify but what the heck happened with Spotify. Too many restrictions like we can skip the music, only 6 times per hour amd not more than that or renew tomorrow. we can't play songs in order it follows random songs (smart shuffle). Too many ads and it says that if this ad comes then uninterrupted music for 30 mins but in 10 mins another ad will come. I don't know why, why Spotify came up with these much restrictions. we can't listen our music freely? i need some answer from Spotify team.
replyContent: Hi. If you’re on our free service, you can only shuffle music except on certain Spotify playlists such as those made for you. To have full control over listening, we'd recommend checking out our Premium plans. If you've never had Premium before, you should be eligible for our trial. You can also see our other deals by visiting spotify.com/premium.

content: It used to be my favourite music platform but I can't believe they went to this extent that I can't even play a song I want to listen to until or unless I have a premium account. They set a limit for a day to listen to whatever you want and have to wait for tomorrow, till then you have to listen to whatever song they play for you. So now you can't play more than 7 songs a day! Just incredible!

The app was overall good until the new update. I don't like the fact that shuffle off option isn't available for free users. I would personally like it if that is given for free users as well. There seems to be no purpose of creating a playlist in order if u can't listen to it the way u want. Please change it. JUST BECAUSE I USE THE FREE VERSION DOESNT MEAN I CANT LISTEN TO ANY SONG OF MY CHOICE WORST APP EVER. any music app should have basic options like switch to any song whenever u want.

They continue to make the premium version more expensive, and the free version gets worse and worse, with more and more adds to the point it's almost unbearable. Not to mention they have like a total of 3 adds that get played over and over and over its insufferable, Do they really not have any different adds they can play? Makes no sense whatsoever. Also, why does the recommend songs feature stop working with large playlists lol

The best music streaming service. but Spotify should debug more, because there are some infrequent but frustrating bugs and the Spotify app is infamous for it. They are always improving the app and adding more custom for you content which is really cool. By far the best for the way they serve music to you, every update has a new way to enjoy your music, you'll never get bored or find you music taste/exploration stagnating, Spotify knows your favourite songs and your next favourite song.

Spotify is an exceptional platform, easily earning a perfect 5/5 stars! Aesthetically, the app boasts a sleek, dark-themed interface that is both modern and easy on the eyes. Navigation is intuitive, allowing for effortless discovery of new music and podcasts. The visually appealing album art and artist profiles enhance the overall experience. What makes Spotify unique is its profound understanding of music lovers' needs. ✨

The worst "free" music app of all time. I can't even listen to a song because it will give me a random one instead of the one I picked. And when I did have premium, it still happened. I couldn't even have a playlist without a terrible song popping out of nowhere. I really don't understand the hype for this app, if I could I would instantly put negative stars. The only reason you're still getting money is your previous fame. I would rather use an MP3 than this.

More and more ads going longer and longer. None of them skippable any more. Can't turn off videos in ads now either, so mandatory ad videos eat your data. The app keeps saying "enjoy the next 30 minutes uninterrupted" but then it interrupts it with several ads every 2 songs! If this is a bug they haven't fixed it for more than a year. If you pay to remove the ads the price keeps going up.
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear this, and we'll pass your feedback along to the Ads team. For an ad-free experience, we'd recommend checking out our Premium plans. If you've never had Premium before, you should be eligible for our trial. You can also check out other deals by heading over to spotify.com/premium.

content: had been a member for 5 plus years. I think when I started it was like $7. now $13. I decided to try the free version. Spotify's free version is for the user to pull their hair out and go back to premium. For every 2 min song you listen to, there is two commercials .that equal a minute. After every song... 2 commercials. terrible. YouTube is cheaper. has everything spotify has. plus much more. 2 commercials to every song. smh
replyContent: Hey! We're sorry to hear this, and we'll pass your feedback along to the Ads team. For an ad-free experience, we'd recommend checking out our Premium plans. If you've never had Premium before, you should be eligible for our trial. You can also check out other deals by heading over to spotify.com/premium.

content: Updated April 30, 2025. still refuse to fix the problem. no way to clear the queue in the app still. Won't load liked songs. Discover weekly will also not update Edit: still plays the same 30 rap songs from my liked list and they won't fix it. If I wasn't on a student account, I would have canceled my subscription by now. Nov 14, 2024 - queue still doesn't work and app is very glitchy. Will unsubscribe as soon as my student account runs out. :)
replyContent: Hey there! Does restarting your device make any difference? If that doesn't work, we suggest reaching out to our Customer Service at http://support.spotify.com. Just search "Contact Us", and they'll be happy to help you out.

content: I don't understand why your app keeps behaving as if I have no internet access, it is the latest updated version, every other app/site works perfectly on my phone, just Spotify, for some reason tells me I'm offline, I can't even log in to subscribe. And mind you don't mention VPNs, cause im not using any. Get back and fix this as soon as possible

It’s honestly frustrating that this app makes you pay just to skip to a specific part of a song. That’s such a basic feature, why is it behind a paywall? Sometimes I just want to hear the chorus or replay a verse, and not being able to do that without premium feels like a cheap way to force subscriptions. Really disappointing.

Struggles acknowledging downloads, and isn't the clearest app or user friendly in its use. Then there are the adverts during podcasts the algorithm gets it very wrong at times be warned if your using a speaker as the choices can be very off, and lead to anyone nearby wondering about what your tastes and life choices ..all thanks to the Spotify algorithm.

very nice app but greediness and their thirst of money through premiums make it worst. they aren't even providing basic features like playing song like we want. we can't play next song. only 6 times next song button can be used in an hour. if you used 6 times you can't without premium. you can't chose which song you want to play from playlist, you can't even play from specific duration from where you want to listen the song. it's doing monoply over music and forcing tto buy premium. worst app.
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: The premium really worth the price. I can easily access a huge library for a few bucks, compared to traditionally owning a copy. Been using it as my primary music player for a few years. But organizing playlist in mobile app is a frustration as there's no way I can select multiple items. Come on devs, it's 2025 already and this basic necessity for music player is still missing.

whenever I'm out of subscription I'll have to redownload and add songs all over again and also this app doesn't function well whenever I'm out of subscription it's not fair I don't even get the chance to use offline mode anymore, it's just there for fancy....I basically deleted audiomack for all these nonsense ... please fix it.

I've been using this app for years and I slowly saved up many songs and playlists, it was nice since I got to explore other music genres with their weekly playlists of "Just For You'" playlists―a cool feature not gonna lie. However, as I use this app, it's getting greedier―it has more ads, smart shuttle, and cannot adjust the playback progress bar! Also, you NEED to fix a bug where the song randomly stops and when I click play it just restarts the song all over again, it also crashes the app.

decent app, ive been using it for many years. only downside is the premium thing, like i get it they gotta chase that bag, but its insufferable. 4 ads in a row is ridiculous. i should not have to pay to listen to music with no ads, on queue and unlimited skips... pretty much the only feature that pisses me off- but it gets the work done i guess. oh and the 3 month free premium thing is a scam, you have to pay anyway, if it were free, you wouldnt need to pay.

I have been using Spotify for over 10 years with very few issues. Recently though, more and more things started going wrong, issues that based on what I saw online have been around for years, e.g. couldn't listen to songs unless they were on a playlist (desktop). Today halfway thru a song, I got the songs stop after 9/10 seconds bug on the app. Tried all the fixes, none worked. Reinstalled the app and now it won't even let me log back in. Super cool, happy to be paying for this
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: Decent options but too slow. In the last few months it feels like Spotify has gotten a lot less responsive. I have very fast Wi-Fi/data, but it still often takes up to a minute for the home screen to load properly when I open the app. I don't have this problem with any other apps. For a company that makes so much money, you'd have thought they would have found a way for a smoother user experience.

This was the best music app ever I have used. i have started using it for many years(about 4 or 5). but recently, about within 2-3 weeks, i can't find any songs in it. songs have disappeared from my all playlists, my liked songs. not even getting any single song while searching. it's been like a new account. I would be glad if you fix this issue. except this, all the features, I love it. still it's the best music app!! hope you will fix this problem. let me know why it's like this!😌✨

I have subscribe to spotify premium, but what I got is buggy and lagging apps. first it doesn't want to play to the next song, no queue available. I tried to update it, clear cache, and even try to reinstall it. And it is going so much worse. it won't even play even a single song. I tested my internet, all good and works perfectly besides spotify.

I loved the premium experience of Spotify, which I paid for for around a year. But everything changed when I reverted to the free model (due to a change in lifestyle, I was going to need it less). And how ugly of a face you have shown, Spotify! The free plan is filthy and malicious! I hate to do it but I'm learning how to move my tracks to YT Music because of this! And you'll never get another rupee from me again!

I personally don't like this app that much because if u don't have premium, then u can BARELY do anything in here. there's lots of ads every second and when I try to listen to a specific song It doesn't let me listen to it, when I search the song and click on a playlist, no songs turn on. I waited for 5 minutes, and it still didn't turn on. so it has a bug that they have to fix. It would be nice if I would be able to enjoy some music without paying money, but I guess it's not possible, sadly.

This app is so obsessed with premium that it just won't let you hear your song peacefully. In the very first the app behaves and let you plays all you favourite but as the time passes by you can see its true colours . I'm so frustrated. I was just listening to my spotify then it suddenly went on loading. The playlist is loading really slow and searching for a specific song is taking a long time to load. 2024/8/31: I really hate that I need to buy the premium to see the lyrics of a song like this is so basic for a music app. Look the only good part in this is that you can find many songs that you can't find in other music apps. 2025/4/19: They fixed some of the issues I had for the past few months. From 2 stars I need to put it at 4.7. I am still experiencing some issues but not like before. They really did a great job, and I can say that proudly.

Spotify becomes more and more useless. Downloaded songs disappear and or can not be played, because internet connection is not available (that's why I downloaded songs). Spotify (chat-bot support only) states: "We're continuously improving you Spotify experience". While I can not play my playlists, because Spotify undownloaded playlists. It works, if you have a stable internet connection or do not allow internet at all, but background app usage is high.
replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search “Contact Us”, and they'll be happy to help.

content: OK. before this year, this app was fine. but now. problems that I hate: 1. you can only skip 6 songs an hour. HOW STUPID IS THAT???? 2. you don't get a choice whether the app adds random songs to new playlists. 3. you can't choose which song plays. these three problems need to be fixed. I don't care. Just get. it. fixed. otherwise, this is a good app when you don't have a premium for YouTube music... though there are some songs that I want to be added.

absolutely the worst after I purchased a subscription. right after the subscription ended they are asking premium subscription for everything. I'm limited to the number of songs i can seek to the start. they don't allow you to even replay the music from the beginning after a few times. they don't even let you play the songs in a playlist without a shuffle. it has become the absolute worst I'm the greedy after profit. the app delivers something exactly opposite to what music does. its nuts

The app is very useful, but if you don't have Spotify premium, it could be a small of a problem. Sometimes the app doesn't let you skip the song, it plays rendom songs that are not in the Playlist, it doesn't let you change from shuffle and it doesn't let you pick the song you wanna hear from the playlis by clicking on the song. But eather wise it's a pretty useful app from my opinion.

You must have Spotify premium to use this app. without paying, Spotify is the worst app known to mankind. I mean you can't even listen to music on this thing- the amount of ads, you can't shuffle, loop or skip, like bro. basic music necessities are spat on when ure not paying. but when u do pay, which trust me u eventually will if u intend to use this app, it's an awesome app w cool features like personalized everyday playlists who actually know ur taste, cool wraps, aesthetic, etc.

although id like to give spotify a 5 star rating, for the last couple of days ive been experiencing crashes on the app and music just stopping on its own. ive used spotify for quite some years now and this is the first time ive had such difficulty just listening to tunes. maybe the support team can go in there and do whatever it is that can be done to repair the software. ive heard quite a few ppl complain about this same issue. thanks.
replyContent: Hi. We had a little hiccup earlier but everything should be running just fine now. If the same issue persists even after a quick reinstall of the app, give Customer Service a shout. Just search “Contact Us” at support.spotify.com.

content: I really like Spotify It has a pretty large selection of music and some cool.features like song radio etc. However it just crashes far too often and right now I have spent over an hour trying to listen to some music only for the app to be unresponsive...I have done literally anything possible to fix this issue and tried it on multiple devices. This is simply unacceptable, especially since I actually pay for the subscription

Spotify the past 2 weeks, has turned terrible! every 2nd song won't play on my playlists anymore. a song will be silent, then you click on the previous & next tracks, they play, but not the song that is currently meant to be playing or the song you want to hear. Also the "shuffle" system is trash! I have playlists with over 800 songs, yet the same 30+ songs always get played. same artist gets played 3 songs in a row. uninstalled & reinstalled the app & the same problems. do better please!!
replyContent: Hi! We’re sorry to hear this and thanks for letting us know. We’d like to investigate further. content: I have been using Spotify for 4 or 5 years now. But today I'm done. I had the DJ playlist going while on the highway headed out of town. Outside of Toronto on the 401 and 115 highways there are a couple dead zones where you get little to no cell reception. I passed through one of these areas and Spotify just had a complete meltdown. Gave me the typical lost connection message so I waited to get a good signal again to resume playback. But I can't get it to load anything now. I've reinstalled 3x
replyContent: Hi! We had a little hiccup earlier but everything should be running just fine now. If the same issue persists, give Customer Service a shout. Just search “Contact Us” at support.spotify.com.

content: finally done with Spotify after years. This app just constantly frustrates me. The home screen regularly shows me irrelevant artists or podcasts. My biggest issue though. is that the app constantly claims I'm offline even when I have full signal and am clearly using the internet for other apps in my phone. I'm switching to YouTube music and won't be looking back, it's been too long and it's getting too expensive to pay for something that wastes so much of my time.

Worst music app on the market. I've had Spotify for over 5 years now, and the application is awful. It feels like it is getting worse every time I open, freezing, not loading, not connecting etc. I've had to uninstall and reinstall the app multiple times. I'm seriously thinking of just abandoning my playlist catalog it's that bad.

I've been a premium user for years and I always loved how Spotify introduced me to new music. I could look for any genre or mood and find lots of new music to listen to. Now everything I search for and every playlist they suggest is just the same songs I listen to all the time and songs I already have saved. All the playlists seem to be just AI generated now where they used to be good it's just very repetitive now. Is there a way to make that optional?

The new UI is trash, it's reshuffled all my songs in play lists and in my saved songs, also it never plays music in the order on the list it jumps around almost like its on shuffle but you can't do anything about it. All my songs also keep getting deleted. I pay them money so I can listen to music while out and about but they consistently let me down.

The way the app is laid out is intuitive and is easy to navigate but the performance of the app is terrible. Loading different pages takes an unbelievably long time in general, even with strong wifi. This is particularly frustrating when trying to access downloaded songs when offline. What is the point of having downloadable songs/podcasts if not to listen to them whilst offline or in an area of patchy signal? Why does the app need to spend so long loading these?

The most recent update is a nightmare for trying to queue songs. After playing the first song queued up the rest are wiped off so you can only really queue one song at a time. Trying to re-order the queue is now really laggy and unpredictable so this isn't a viable alternative to queuing songs. The app also starts playing songs but with no actual audio mid-way through a playlist. Pretty disappointed with the app right now

Very stable, good quality although not perfect quality (platforms like Tidal have much better quality, but are incredibly unstable). I miss the old Daily Discovery, which gave you recommendations based on what you were listening to. The new Discovery just shows you artists or songs you already listen to. Has all the songs I want, from games and movies to niche genres that died in the '90s and 2000s.

Becoming buggier and weirder with every update. just now started showing empty loading screen at start, opening my album can crash the app, music quality remains stagnant while price increases, lots of unrelated features are squeezed in (like podcasts). App losing the reason it exists (internet radio / music streamer without ads for a premium). If you want to develop extra features, make a premium tier "I want to pay for new features" or "shutupandtakemymoney". And "I just want my music" tier.

This app has a huge problem with it's Playlist. Everytime I try to play my favourite Playlist, it will be normal for the first 2 or 3 songs, but after that it will play songs from only one artist continuously. Every single song from the same artist, despite the list clearly having a variety of different artist. I don't know why it does this, but people are going to stop using your platform if problems like this continue.
replyContent: We're sorry to hear that you're experiencing issues with the app. We recommend clearing your cache following the steps under "Storage Information" > "Manage memory usage" at http://support.spotify.com. If you’re still having issues, you can get in touch with our Customer Service. Just search for “Contact Us”, and they'll be happy to help.

content: Hello to the Spotify team. I've been using the app since 2019 i.e, F2P . Back then it was really good but nowadays the app is not up to the mark. I know there should be some upgrades but the update u plp bring is really not appreciated by many of the users. This time you have not let users listen to the songs which they like. You are just giving few choices like 4 or maximum choice to choose them. This is really disappointing, please change that and change the smart shuffle option.

(this has improved) haven't noticed big issues playingmy library out of signal. Offline playing is such a massive issue. Access to your songs and library gets ridiculously slow and sometimes inaccessible. If there is no WiFi or 4g it becomes a really annoying clunky app. Please sort this out. Offline mode should be smooth and allow access to anything played before. Online is great. I love the app.

It is a pay to listen typ of service because every feature that I need has to be payed for. It also bothers me that all of the Playlists are shuffled and that you have to pay to listen to the song that you like. I'd prefer YouTube Music because there are less ads visible and you can turn shuffled Playlists on and off without having to pay 14$. Use YouTube Music for a better listening experience!!!

Whilst never the most responsive app, since the last update, I can occasionally use the search function without needing a calendar to measure how long it takes. When the homepage eventually loads, I'm greeted with all of the new podcasts from creators I follow. Unfortunately, I can't listen to them via the app, as they never load. Were it not for the fact that the web version works pretty well, I'd be taking my monthly music subscription elsewhere.

1. When resuming a song after a while without an internet connection, it doesn't load. I have to skip back. 2. I hit the "loop only one" song button and it looped from where I hit the button, not from the beginning of the song. 3. Sometimes the desktop app bugs out when I want to play a song from my phone and it removes the song. Who thought it would be a good idea to remove the option to remove songs from the queue?

This was the best music app ever "WAS". The new app updates just removed the basic features of the music app, almost everything requires premium now. I've been using it for more than 4 years, These new updates didn't make anything easier or better, everything seems to be useless at this point. Listening to music was perfect before, now it's just annoying coz there's literally no way of listening to songs the way we want to, deleting is the only solution if this doesn't change.

Having constant connectivity issues on the app. Whether I am connected to Wifi or Cellular, I keep having connectivity issues inside the app, nothing loads. I am pretty confident that there is no issue with the connection as I test it with other apps & speed testers. This has been going on for a while inside the app. I believe it is Spotify related. Hope it will be fixed
replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search “Contact Us”, and they'll be happy to help.

content: The release radar feature is really bad at "learning" what I don't want to listen to. I've down voted remixes of the same song (and specific genres) every week for a year now. content: i love spotify! i have premium and listen to music all day long. but please. I get this is all down to being the free version but then just give me a greyed out play button with a premium icon on it, this is an awful way of trying to get me to go premium.

This app is completely worthless and you can't use this aap for a single month consistently. im sitting at home surfing youtube, when I suddenly have the urge to put on my playlist on spotify. I go on spotify, and it says, "something went wrong, check your internet connection."
